question.text: When should you use hazard warning lights?

explanation.text:
Hazard warning lights are fitted to all modern cars and some motorcycles. They should be used to warn
• other road users when your vehicle is causing a temporary obstruction; for example, after a collision or when it’s broken down
• following drivers on a motorway of a hazard or obstruction ahead.
They shouldn’t be used as an excuse for dangerous or illegal parking.

answer.text: When you slow down quickly on a motorway because of a hazard ahead
When you leave your car at the roadside to visit a shop
When you wish to stop on double yellow lines
When you need to park on the pavement
